description: From Middle English incredible, from Latin incrēdibilis (“that cannot be believed”), from in- (“not”) + crēdibilis (“worthy of belief”), from crēdō (“believe”).

adjectives.description: incredible (comparative more incredible, superlative most incredible)

entries.meaning: (literally) Too implausible to be credible; beyond belief; unbelievable. [from 15th c.]
examples: I get lost in what is credible and not credible. This whole thing gets so incredible when you consider wiping out whole nations, it is difficult to establish credibility.
He was so wrapped up in watching the incredible special effects that he couldn't keep track of the story.
I had such an incredible slice of pizza last night that I simply can't think about anything else.
